category: Units of Length with Dual Meanings
explanation: Foot, Yard, Rod, and Chain are all units of length that also commonly refer to specific physical objects or places. Mile is primarily just a unit of length, without a distinct common noun meaning for a physical object or place.
George Washington, John Adams, Thomas Jefferson, and James Madison all served as early US Presidents. Benjamin Franklin was a prominent Founding Father but never held the office of President.
ATE, FOR, WON, and TOO are all homophones of single-digit numbers (8, 4, 1, and 2 respectively). BLUE does not share this characteristic.
